title: RamSafe
text:
Shared call out



This is an example of a shared callout box
_shared-call-out.qmd


This project, initiated and managed by SSG alum Inho Park, worked with multiple institutional stakeholders to design service quality improvements to VCU’s “RamSafe” ride service. This required a deep exploration of routing and ride hailing software, as well as sustained engagement with a rapidly growing startup in this field.
Github repo: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-trc-dashboard
improving user experience with VCU RamSafe by discovering ways to work with The Routing Company, RamSafe’s vendor for mapping and routing services

title: CHSV Website
text: The CHSV website redevelopment offers a fresh take on the website of an important local history organization, refactoring the site around specific goals rather than general information.

title: Hello World!  We’re Software for Social Good
text:
Who We Are






A VIP Team at VCU
The VIP Consortium is a non-profit alliance established to support & promote the success of Vertically Integrated Projects (VIPs) in colleges and universities worldwide. VIP is an award-winning educational construct developed at Georgia Tech & Purdue University and refined for over 25 years.
Learn more about VIP Programs












Creating Softwares that Benefits Communities

Develop Team


The developers consist of students with backgrounds in computer science, data analytics, cyber security, and more. Together, they collaborate to address software engineering challenges and deliver the most optimal solution.

title: Hello World!  We’re Software for Social Good
text:
Why Work With Us?

The VIP Consortium is a non-profit alliance established to support & promote the success of Vertically Integrated Projects (VIPs) in colleges and universities worldwide. VIP is an award-winning educational construct developed at Georgia Tech & Purdue University and refined for over 25 years.


1. Discover New Network & Insights

Engage in or support projects with durations extending beyond a single semester or year, offering flexibility to accommodate diverse schedules.






2. Adaptable Project Timelines

Engage in or support projects with durations extending beyond a single semester or year, offering flexibility to accommodate diverse schedules.






3. Team That Grows With You

Engage in or support projects with durations extending beyond a single semester or year, offering flexibility to accommodate diverse schedules.








Start Your Journey With Us
The VIP Consortium is a non-profit alliance established to support & promote the success of Vertically Integrated Projects (VIPs) in colleges and universities worldwide. VIP is an award-winning educational construct developed at Georgia Tech & Purdue University.




Join Next Cohort 


Open to undergraduate and graduate students at VCU.






Partner a Project 


Whether you are a business, non-profit organization, or a start up.

title: Project test
text: this is my first description line for this project.

title: Small Business and Supplier Diversity Chatbot
text:
SSG designed, deployed and delivered a chatbot that can be accessed from specific pages within a website as well as from within a web-based application by clicking a link or button. The chatbot was able to answer questions typed into a provided field, based on a list of questions and corresponding answers maintained with the chat bot system. The chatbot should also have the ability to route the user to their choice of additional support through phone and email.
Client site: https://sbsd.virginia.gov/ Github repo:https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-sbsd-chatbot GH pages: https://vcu-ssg.github.io/ssg-sbsd-chatbot/
Students: Paul Reid

title: Fortnite Exploration
text:
As Chris Dixon once noted, emerging technologies start out looking like toys, or in this case, video games. The Unreal Engine for Forrnite (UEFN) and related Verse programming language, made by Epic Games, is a massively powerful tool for creating user generated content in a massive online world. We are exploring how to meaningfully build content for daily life of a university student based on “game” interfaces.
Github repo:https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-gamedev-uefn-verse GH pages: https://vcu-ssg.github.io/ssg-gamedev-uefn-verse/getting-started-with-verse.html

title: Client Platform Analysis
text: SSG is contributing to a platform service provider review with IT4Cause, supporting the mission of Islamic Relief USA as they explore options for a new case management provider. This activity allows our students to focus on a crucial aspect of software work: making a case for a particular implementation based on very specific organizational needs.

title: Medical Deibrillator Simulator
text: (Add description of project here. 2-3 sentences) Github repo:https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-medical-p5-defib

title: Innovation Ecosystem Mapping
text:
This project prototyped a map of the regional innovation ecosystem for Activation Capital, facilitating access to resources and information for venture founders, venture funders, and innovation support organizations.
Github repo: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-inno-eco-mapping

title: Liquid Strategies Proposal Generator
text:
SSG designed, developed and delivered a client proposal generator tool. The tool automates the creation and customization of briefing presentations, allowing employees to focus more on the content of the presentation and less on the boilerplate. SSG delivered a working, deployable application with training videos for employees.
Client site: https://lsfunds.com/ GH page site: https://vcu-ssg.github.io/ssg-quarto-overlay-finreport/ Github repo: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-quarto-overlay-finreport
Students: Moses Farley, Zach McDonough, Nitin Kanuri, Inho Park

title: OMS Anesthesia Emergency Simulation
text:
This project offers initial design and prototyping for a surgical anesthesia training simulator for oral and maxillofacial surgeons. The design is based on task flows incorporated into OMS training and certification, and serves to sustain and develop the relevant skills base among practitioners.
Github repo: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-medical-oms-simulator

title: SSG website
text:
Shared call out



This is an example of a shared callout box
_shared-call-out.qmd


This project develops our own website, both as a means of training students on contemporary web development tools and techniques and as a means of creating a visible public face for our activities. As a multi-project, crossfunctional VIP, we have a rich and varied story to tell, and we are making a website that lets our participants show the world their excellent work!
Github repo: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-quarto-website
